entries.meaning: (philosophy) Lack of essence; that which is not essence.

verbs.description: unessence (third-person singular simple present unessences, present participle unessencing, simple past and past participle unessenced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deprive of its essential nature.
examples: Education is a vital process involving intelligent, growing, sensitive and dynamic human elements and it becomes mechanical at the risk of unessencing itself.
